page.title: 05RISELEY VILLAGE BLACKSMITH(l
page.content: Mr. Pentlow is the son and grand- son of blacksmiths, who took over the 300 years old smithy forge in l9l6. For many years the main business was shoeing horses and the skills used were in heating and shaping metal with a hammer. Some wrought iron work such as gates and fences was done also. Now Mr. Pentlow, who has run the buiness for 25 years deals mostly with broken farm machinery and he has to be skil- ful in arc-welding. He wears overalls and special protective clothing including a special mask to shield his eyes from the strong arc light. The workshop on the High Street is built on the same site as the old smithy, which he demolished. No horse shoeing is done now - all horses go to a farrier.
